newsitem.title: USA: Quarterdeck restructures, sees Q4 net loss.
newsitem.headline: Quarterdeck restructures, sees Q4 net loss.

text.p: Quarterdeck Corp said Monday its fourth quarter and year-end results will fall "well below expectations" because it is undertaking a comprehensive restructuring meant to return the company to profitability.
Costs associated with the restrcturing, previously announced acquisition-related charges and less-than-expected revenues will cause a significant charge to fourth quarter results, the company said.
The company didn't specify the charge amount but said it will contribute to a net loss for the fiscal year ended September 30.

The restructuring includes about a 40 percent work force cut, a refocusing of its management around two business units and a new, direct marketing unit and plans to release a new version of its CleanSweep software and a new hard drive optimization utility, Partition-It, in the near future.
The company said it also completed a $20 million convertible preferred offering whose proceeds will be used for restructuring, working capital and general corporate purposes.
Quarterdeck said the layoffs announced today were in addition to an 11 percent workforce cut announced in June.
At that point, the company had a total of 1,300 employees. A spokeswoman said Quarterdeck was now seeking to reduce its remaining 1,100 employees by about 40 percent.
According to First Call, analysts' mean estimate for the fourth quarter was for Quarterdeck to report earnings of $0.12 a share versus earnings of nil in the year-ago quarter.
For full year 1995, Quarterdeck reported earnings of $0.45 a share.
